sentence: 1 |||  ||| 0.1 ||| OBJECTIVES The goal of this study was to determine the effects of exercise training (ET) on functional capacity and quality of life (QOL) in patients who received percutaneous transluminal coronary angioplasty (PTCA) or coronary stenting (CS), the effects on the restenosis rate and the outcome.
content: percutaneous transluminal coronary angioplasty (PTCA) or coronary stenting (CS)
label: po.Procedure

sentence: 3 |||  ||| 0.3 ||| METHODS We studied 118 consecutive patients with coronary artery disease (mean age 57 Ϯ 10 years) who underwent PTCA or CS on one (69%) or two (31%) native epicardial coronary arteries.
label: po.Size

sentence: 24 |||  ||| 0.24 ||| Primary angioplasty, defined as angioplasty without thrombolytic therapy, was performed 148 Ϯ 63 min after the onset of an acute myocardial infarction (AMI) in 23 patients (11 in group T, 12 in group C).
content: 23 patients (11 in group T, 12 in group C)
label: po.Size

sentence: 39 |||  ||| 0.39 ||| After a 15-min phase of stretching and calisthenics, patients pedaled on an electronically braked cycle ergometer at the target work rate for 30 min.
label: i.Procedure

sentence: 41 |||  ||| 0.41 ||| Control patients were recommended to perform basic daily mild physical activities but to avoid any physical training.
label: i.Procedure

sentence: 5 |||  ||| 0.5 ||| Group T (n ϭ 59) was exercised three times a week for six months at 60% of peak V ˙ O 2.
label: i.Procedure

sentence: 38 |||  ||| 0.38 ||| The program lasted six months and consisted of three exercise sessions per week at an intensity of 60% of peak oxygen uptake (V ˙ O 2 ).
content: at an intensity of 60% of peak oxygen uptake
label: i.Procedure

sentence: 12 |||  ||| 0.12 ||| CONCLUSIONS Moderate ET improves functional capacity and QOL after PTCA or CS.
content: Moderate ET improves functional capacity and QOL
label: o.Treatment

sentence: 139 ||| RESULTS ||| 1.35 ||| The progression of coronary artery disease was significantly lower in trained patients than it was in control patients at six months.
label: o.Patient

sentence: 7 |||  ||| 0.7 ||| RESULTS Only trained patients had significant improvements in peak V ˙ O 2 (26%, p Ͻ 0.001) and quality of life (26.8%, p ϭ 0.001 vs. C).
content: Only trained patients had significant improvements in peak V ˙ O 2
label: o.Patient
